text: The arrondissement of Mirande is an arrondissement of France. It is part of the Gers département in the Occitanie region. Its capital is the city of Mirande. ==History== When the arrondissements were created on 17 February 1800, Mirande was one of them in the Gers department. ==Geography== It is the southernmost and the smallest of the arrondissements of the department, with an area of . It is also the arrondissement with fewer people living there, with 37,945 inhabitants and a population density of inhabitants/km². The arrondissement is bordered to the north by the Auch and Condom arrondissements, to the southeast by the Haute-Garonne department, to the south by the Hautes-Pyrénées and the Pyrénées-Atlantiques departments, and to the west by the Landes department. ==Composition== ===Cantons=== After the reorganisation of the cantons in France, cantons are not subdivisions of the arrondissements so they could have communes that belong to different arrondissements. In the arrondissement of Mirande, there are two cantons where not all their "communes" are in the arrondissement: Astarac-Gimone and Fezensac. The following table shows the distribution of the "communes" in the cantons and arrondissements: Cantons and communes in the arrondissement of Mirande INSEE Code Canton Arrondissements Total Auch Condom Mirande 3201 Adour-Gersoise 35 35 3203 Astarac-Gimone 19 24 43 3208 Fezensac 15 13 5 33 3215 Mirande-Astarac 43 43 3216 Pardiac-Rivière-Basse 43 43 ===Communes=== The arrondissement of Mirande has 150 communes; they are (with their INSEE codes): #
